googleErrorReportingR 0.0.3

error_reporting

Source: vignettes/error_reporting.Rmd
error_reporting.Rmd
library(googleErrorReportingR)

Context

Having a central place where we can gather errors and warnings from our R code is particularly relevant when we have deployed our code and have users actively making use of the services we have set up. Users will not always bother to report an error, and in the case of API’s where the users are other machines, this is even more unlikely.

IaaS platforms such as Google Cloud Platform typically have monitoring and loggin services available. This package offers you convenience wrapper around the projects.events API to report errors of your services.

Message format

For some language Google has implemented functionality to capture the stacktrace and use that as a basis for a report. When using R code we need to create the erorr message, but note that we can still include dynamic content. For instance, we can setup a tryCatch() call and output the e (error) to a Error Reporting call.

          message = "Error description",
          # service
          service = "My Service",
          version = "0.0.1",
          # context
          method = "GET",
          url = "https://example.com",
          userAgent = "",
          referrer = "",
          responseStatusCode = "500",
          remoteIp = "192.178.0.0.1",
          user = "UserID",
          #reportLocation
          filepath

note we leave the following items out for the following reasons - “eventTime”: string, – this has to be formated to Zulu, this is possible, but much easier to just rely on the event time. If you do want to include time note that you will need to use the Zulu format requried by Google. For example

message$eventTime <- format(lubridate::now(), "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")
  • “@type”: string - Optional. For information on this field, see Specify @type.
